Constructor Detail

Merger

public Merger(java.lang.String s,
              java.lang.String g,
              boolean useRaceData)
Combines Census population files with the Census shapefile DBF.

Parameters:
s - The shapefile's location, as a String.
g - The population header file's location, as a String.
useRaceData - Whether or not to use race data. A boolean. Joshua.Justice@gatech.edu

Merger

Combines Census population files with the Census shapefile DBF.

Parameters:
s - The shapefile.
g - The population header file.
useRaceData - Whether or not to use race data. A boolean. Joshua.Justice@gatech.edu
Method Detail

setPopFiles

public void setPopFiles(java.lang.String p1,
                        java.lang.String p2)
Parameters:
p1 - The "00001" population file's location, as a String.
p2 - The "00002" population file's location, as a String. If the racial data is desired, pass in the population filenames here. The 00001 file is whole population, 00002 file is 18+. Right now, it is assumed that if you want one, you want both, thus both are required.

setPopFiles

public void setPopFiles(java.io.File p1,
                        java.io.File p2)
Parameters:
p1 - The "00001" population file.
p2 - The "00002" population file. If the racial data is desired, pass in the population filenames here. The 00001 file is whole population, 00002 file is 18+. Right now, it is assumed that if you want one, you want both, thus both are required.

getCountyNo

public java.lang.String getCountyNo()
This function assumes that the first entry in the shapefile is in the desired county. It will return the matching county number.

merge

public void merge(java.lang.String countyNo)
Parameters:
countyNo - The number of the county in the Census data. Use null to get the whole state. Merges the files in-memory. The countyNo is the number of the county in the Census data. Use getCountyNo() function to get that value if it is unknown. The code only cares about what rows are in the shapefile. So if you want county data, merge the county shapefile with the state population header file. You'll get a combined file that only has the county data.

createMappings

public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> createMappings()
This is used to make life easier in the main method.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
